sentences: Nad olid tehes plaane järgmiseks nädalaks.
context: The word 'tehes' is the elative case (fromative) form of the verb 'tegema', which means 'to make' or 'to do'. In Estonian, this form indicates that something is being made/done from a source or point in time. It shows an ongoing action in progress and can be translated to English as 'making' or 'doing' with the '-ing' form of verbs.
